mainBoard.flavorText: A screech in the night is all it takes for Orzhov debtors to clutch at their coin purses.
mainBoard.name: Basilica Screecher
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {WB}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain from extort is based on the total amount of life lost, not necessarily the number of opponents you have. For example, if your opponent's life total can't change (perhaps because that player controls Platinum Emperion), you won't gain any life.
The extort ability doesn't target any player.
The extort ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability resolves even if that spell is countered.
You may pay {W/B} a maximum of one time for each extort triggered ability. You decide whether to pay when the ability resolves.

foreignData.flavorText: « Ooh, celui-là a l'air bien amoché... Peut-être qu'ils enverront Proft ! »

foreignData.flavorText: 「うわあ、これは凄惨な事件だ。プロフトが派遣されるかも！」

mainBoard.flavorText: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
mainBoard.name: Fleshbag Marauder
mainBoard.originalText: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: As Fleshbag Marauder's ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is chooses a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order does the same knowing the choices made before them. Then all those creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
When its ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

mainBoard.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters, each player sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Even the darkest corners of Ravnica still lie in the shadow of the Church.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain from extort is based on the total amount of life lost, not necessarily the number of opponents you have. For example, if your opponent's life total can't change (perhaps because that player controls Platinum Emperion), you won't gain any life.
The extort ability doesn't target any player.
The extort ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. The ability resolves even if that spell is countered.
You may pay {W/B} a maximum of one time for each extort triggered ability. You decide whether to pay when the ability resolves.

mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever Orzhov Racketeers deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Afterlife 2 (When this creature dies, create two 1/1 white and black Spirit creature tokens with flying.)

rulings.text: Because blockers are chosen all at once, you can’t block with a creature with afterlife, wait for it to die, then block with the resulting Spirit tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText: The sigil holds different meanings depending on its form and presentation. While some wear it as a sign of status, others wear it as a sign of debt.
mainBoard.name: Orzhov Signet

mainBoard.flavorText: As far as the Orzhov Syndicate is concerned, it is the height of irresponsibility not to have a plan for your own ghost.
mainBoard.name: Afterlife Insurance
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures you control gain afterlife 1 until end of turn. Draw a card. (When a creature with afterlife 1 dies, create a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying.)

rulings.text: Because blockers are chosen all at once, you can't block with a creature with afterlife, wait for it to die, then block with the resulting Spirit tokens.

mainBoard.text: Creatures you control gain afterlife 1 until end of turn. Draw a card. (When a creature with afterlife 1 dies, create a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Laughter and conversation trailed off as the revelers gathered around Zegana's body. Three things quickly became clear: it was a murder, the killer was likely among them, and Teysa's party was definitely over.

foreignData.flavorText: Das Gelächter und die Gespräche verstummten, als die Feiernden sich um Zeganas Leiche scharten. Drei Dinge waren sofort klar: Es war Mord, der Mörder war höchstwahrscheinlich in ihrer Mitte und Teysas Fest war vorüber.
foreignData.name: Mord

foreignData.flavorText: Las risas y las conversaciones se apagaron a medida que los invitados se reunían en torno al cadáver de Zegana. Tres cosas quedaron muy claras en un instante: se trataba de un asesinato, el asesino estaba probablemente entre ellos y la fiesta de Teysa había llegado a su fin.
foreignData.name: Asesinato

foreignData.flavorText: Les rires et les conversations s'arrêtèrent tandis que les fêtards se rassemblaint autour du corps de Zegana. Trois choses furent rapidement évidentes : c'était un meurtre, le tueur était probablement parmi eux et la fête de Teysa était terminée.
foreignData.name: Homicide

foreignData.flavorText: Gli invitati si radunarono intorno al corpo di Zegana e le risate e le chiacchiere iniziarono a spegnersi. Tre cose furono subito chiare: era stato un omicidio, l'assassino era probabilmente tra loro e la festa di Teysa era decisamente finita.
foreignData.name: Omicidio

foreignData.flavorText: 歓楽者たちがゼガーナの遺体の周りに集まると、彼らの笑い声や話し声は次第に静まった。すぐに三つのことが明らかになった。これが殺人であること、犯人は彼らの中の誰かであること、テイサのパーティは間違いなく終わったということ。
foreignData.name: 殺害
foreignData.text: クリーチャー１体を対象とする。それを破壊する。

foreignData.flavorText: O riso e as conversas se extinguiram conforme os convivas se aglomeravam em torno do corpo de Zegana. Três coisas ficaram rapidamente claras: era um assassinato, o assassino ainda estava entre eles e a festa de Teysa havia acabado.
foreignData.name: Homicídio

foreignData.flavorText: 随着狂欢人群聚拢在洁加娜遗体周围，欢声笑语逐渐止歇。大家很快就弄清楚了三件事：这是桩谋杀案；凶手就在众人之间；泰莎的派对当真结束了。
foreignData.name: 谋杀

mainBoard.name: Murder
Parasitic Impetus
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and is goaded. (It attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

rulings.text: If you are the attacking creature's controller, you lose 2 life and gain 2 life. You won't lose the game if your life total is 0 in between these two events.
Parasitic Impetus causes you to gain life, not the attacking creature's controller.

Attacking with a goaded creature doesn't cause it to stop being goaded. If there is an additional combat phase that turn, or if another player gains control of it before it stops being goaded, it must attack again if able.
Being goaded isn't an ability the creature has. Once it's been goaded, it must attack as detailed above even if it loses all abilities.

If a creature you control has been goaded by multiple opponents, it must attack one of your opponents that hasn't goaded it, as that fulfills the maximum number of goad requirements. If a creature you control has been goaded by each of your opponents, the creature must attack an opponent (rather than a planeswalker or battle), but you choose which opponent it attacks.

If the creature doesn't meet any of the above exceptions and can attack, it must attack a player other than the controller of the spell or ability that goaded it if able. If the creature can't attack any of those players but could otherwise attack, it must attack a planeswalker an opponent controls, a battle an opponent controls, or a player who goaded it.

If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature that player controls that's been goaded is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack a player, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack that player.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and is goaded. (It attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Beauty appears in strange places for those with eyes to see it.

{T}: Add {B} or one mana of the chosen color.
mainBoard.text:

{T}: Add {B} or one mana of the chosen color.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"So much wealth. So much splendor. So much temptation to believe the gilded lie."
—Kaya

mainBoard.originalText:
Orzhov Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

rulings.text: Gate is not a basic land type.
The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.

mainBoard.text:
Orzhov Guildgate enters tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

mainBoard.name: Orzhov Basilica
mainBoard.originalText:
Orzhov Basilica enters the battlefield tapped.
When Orzhov Basilica enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{B}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

mainBoard.text:
Orzhov Basilica enters tapped.
When Orzhov Basilica enters, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{B}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Wealthier than ever thanks to exorbitant interest on wartime loans, the Orzhov only grew hungrier for more.
mainBoard.name: Covetous Elegy
mainBoard.originalText: Each player chooses up to two creatures they control, then sacrifices the rest. Then you create a tapped Treasure token for each creature your opponents control.

rulings.text: Players may choose fewer than two creatures even if they control two or more creatures.

Starting with the player whose turn it is, each player in turn order chooses up to two creatures they control, then all of the creatures not chosen by any player are sacrificed at the same time. Players get to know the choices made by players who chose before them.

mainBoard.text: Each player chooses up to two creatures they control, then sacrifices the rest. Then you create a tapped Treasure token for each creature your opponents control.

mainBoard.name: Seraph of the Scales
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Seraph of the Scales gains vigilance until end of turn.
{B}: Seraph of the Scales gains deathtouch until end of turn.
Afterlife 2 (When this creature dies, create two 1/1 white and black Spirit creature tokens with flying.)

rulings.text: Because blockers are chosen all at once, you can’t block with a creature with afterlife, wait for it to die, then block with the resulting Spirit tokens.
Gaining vigilance any time after the moment you choose to attack with a creature won’t cause it to become untapped.
